body:
I decided to make a defense on Rendezvous II, which took a while, but about 30% through completion, about a dozen of my teammates decided to help :D. The defense turned out great, what do you think about it? We could have done more but the game ended xD

http://imgur.com/feUgjmU,MJITQ9c,T1MoJ0y,150W5wg,BX8Dn72,OqsCThX,OnBbmri

title: Good Defense?

replies.body: woot woot i'm in some of those photos, OP defense xP
replies.body_tagged: woot woot i'm in some of those photos, OP defense xP

replies.body: I was there :)
replies.body_tagged: I was there :)

replies.body: What was under the pressure plates? If it was solid stone, I would just skybridge, boat down, clutch to the side, and tunnel. If it was a base under it, then that's an OP defense.
replies.body_tagged: What was under the pressure plates? If it was solid stone, I would just skybridge, boat down, clutch to the side, and tunnel. If it was a base under it, then that's an OP defense.

replies.body: under the stone was layered wood, I was gonna work on that next and fix it since I didn't make that part of the defense, but the game ended ;D
replies.body_tagged: under the stone was layered wood, I was gonna work on that next and fix it since I didn't make that part of the defense, but the game ended ;D

reply_to.body: What was under the pressure plates? If it was solid stone, I would just skybridge, boat down, clutch to the side, and tunnel. If it was a base under it, then that's an OP defense.
reply_to.body_tagged: What was under the pressure plates? If it was solid stone, I would just skybridge, boat down, clutch to the side, and tunnel. If it was a base under it, then that's an OP defense.

replies.body: Levers instead of buttons :)
replies.body_tagged: Levers instead of buttons :)

replies.body:
I would replace all the stone, wool and slabs with wood and wooden slabs, as you don't spawn with an axe (first picture).

If I wouldn't replace the chunk of stone in front of the crafting benches I would remove it all and just place wooden slabs and regular wooden fences random to make it difficult to just run past it (second picture).

I would also keep the front wall with levers but change out all the stone and wool with regular wood or crafting benches, I would also make the front wall at least two or three blocks with iron bars in middle so it would be wood - iron bars - wood (third picture).

I like the build around the monument though I wouldn't cover the monument if the block I'm using isn't transparent. You also have stone below the monument, I would replace it with wood and use slabs instead of pressure plates.
replies.body_tagged:
I would replace all the stone, wool and slabs with wood and wooden slabs, as you don't spawn with an axe (first picture).

If I wouldn't replace the chunk of stone in front of the crafting benches I would remove it all and just place wooden slabs and regular wooden fences random to make it difficult to just run past it (second picture).

I would also keep the front wall with levers but change out all the stone and wool with regular wood or crafting benches, I would also make the front wall at least two or three blocks with iron bars in middle so it would be wood - iron bars - wood (third picture).

I like the build around the monument though I wouldn't cover the monument if the block I'm using isn't transparent. You also have stone below the monument, I would replace it with wood and use slabs instead of pressure plates.
